title: Ticket #864: Windows fetch hook output unpredictable  on multi-core
description:
Windows XP, SP3 Dell Dual Quad-Core Intel Xeon Processor E5405 @ 2Ghz

In testing the hang behavior associated with ticket #422, I noticed that the output from the fetched job for each slot did not always make it into its associated output file. In the output files attached only 4 out of 8 contained data. This behavior hasn't changed between before and after the fix for #422.

The test setup is:

  • fetch.bat - DOS batch file to invoke perl script
  • fetch.pl - Perl script to produce simple job ad
  • condor_config.local - fetch hook config

It doesn't matter if a perl script or DOS batch file is used to create the job ad.
